jcr:content.jcr:title: List of political parties in Costa Rica

contentheadline.headline: List of political parties in Costa Rica

contentrichtext.text: {{Politics of Costa Rica}} This article lists '''[[political party|political parties]] in [[Costa Rica]]'''. Costa Rica used to have a [[two-party system]], which meant that there were two dominant political parties, the [[Social Christian Unity Party]] and the [[National Liberation Party (Costa Rica)|National Liberation Party]], with extreme difficulty for anybody to achieve electoral success under the banner of any other party. After the 2002 elections and the strong showing of the brand-new [[Citizens' Action Party]], it was considered very likely that the old two-party system was on the verge of giving way to a [[multi-party system]]. Several other parties have gained prominence since then, and the 2006 elections made it clear that Costa Rica is now a multi-party system. ==The parties== <!--:''The general rule on naming applies. That means: the parties are named in the English translation and the original native name is placed on the first line of the article unless the native form is more commonly used in English than the English form. Rationale and specifics: See: [[Wikipedia:Naming conventions (use English)]]''.--> ===Parliamentary parties=== {| class="wikitable sortable" ! colspan=2 | Name ! ! Ideology ! [[Legislative Assembly of Costa Rica|Deputies]] |- ! width=5px style="background-color: {{National Liberation Party (Costa Rica)/meta/color}}" | | [[National Liberation Party (Costa Rica)|National Liberation Party]]<br><small>''Partido Liberación Nacional''</small> | PLN | [[Social democracy]] | 24 |- ! style="background-color: {{Citizens' Action Party/meta/color}}" | | [[Citizens' Action Party]]<br><small>''Partido Acción Ciudadana''</small> | PAC | [[Social democracy]] | 11 |- ! style="background-color: {{Libertarian Movement Party/meta/color}}" | | [[Libertarian Movement Party]]<br><small>''Partido Movimiento Libertario''</small> | PML | [[Right-libertarianism]] | 9 |- ! style="background-color: {{Social Christian Unity Party/meta/color}}" | | [[Social Christian Unity Party]]<br><small>''Partido de Unidad Socialcristiana''</small> | PUSC | [[Christian democracy]] | 6 |- ! | | [[Accessibility without Exclusion]]<br><small>''Accesibilidad sin Exclusión''</small> | PASE | [[Conservative]] | 4 |- ! | |[[Costa Rican Renovation Party]] <small>''Partido Renovación Costarricense''</small> | PRN | [[Christian conservative]] | 1 |- ! | | [[National Restoration]]<br><small>''Restauración Nacional''</small> | PASE | [[Christian conservative]] | 1 |- ! | | [[Broad Front (Costa Rica)|Broad Front]]<br><small>''Frente Amplio''</small> | FA | [[Socialism]] | 1 |} === Non-parliamentary parties === * [[National Integration Party (Costa Rica)|National Integration Party]] ===Defunct parties=== * [[Democratic Force (Costa Rica)|Democratic Force]] (''Fuerza Democrática'') * [[Homeland First Party]] (''Partido Patria Primero'') * [[National Integration Party (Costa Rica)|National Integration Party]] (''Partido Integración Nacional'') * [[Popular Vanguard Party]] (''Partido Vanguardia Popular'') * [[Union for Change Party]] (''Partido Unión para el Cambio'') * * [[National Unification Party (Costa Rica)|National Unification Party]], active 1966–1978 ===Provincial parties=== * [[Alajuelense Democratic Action]] (''Acción Democrática Alajuelense''), Alajuela * [[Agrarian Labour Action Party]] (''Partido Acción Laborista Agrícola''), Alajuela ===Local parties=== * [[Party of the Sun (Costa Rica)|Party of the Sun]] (''Partido del Sol'') ==See also== * [[List of political parties]] {{Costa Rican political parties}} {{North America in topic|List of political parties in}} [[Category:Lists of political parties|Costa Rica]] [[Category:Political parties in Costa Rica| ]] [[Category:Costa Rica politics-related lists|Political parties]]
